alert.note: Alert for Union (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 6:31PM EST until January 13 at 7:30AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Laurens, Spartanburg and Union SC. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 PM EST, Rainfall gauges reported totals of 2 to 4 inches across the region over the past 24 hours, with additional heavy rainfall in upstream areas of the Enoree river. This will likely cause flooding to continue along and near the Enoree River channel through the late evening hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fountain Inn, Woodruff, Gray Court, Enoree, Ora, Cross Anchor, Cross Keys and Sedalia. - Flooding will likely impact parts of Beaverdam Church Road and Kilgore Bridge Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
